page.title: 16Rushlye Lodge
page.content: This is at the gate of{Bayham Abbey {Estate.} It is built of limestone, beside a{massive gateway.}Limestone is an extremely old building material. The stone is very soft: that is why many people used it for building houses. The house was there many years ago: an old man lived there and he used to{open the gates for the horses and carriages that were going to the big house which was a mile up the drive. Every year estate workers came to receive a new{free pair of boots}at the Lodge. It is a small house, so the people that live there now are putting an{extension}on the end. When they were digging the ground up to find if it was too soft they found an old well which had a pump. They have a skilled{stone-mason}to build the extension because an ordinary builder coudn't carve the limestone.
